alert.note: Alert for Harlan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 21 at 10:30PM CDT until September 22 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT FOR SMITH...NORTHEASTERN PHILLIPS...SOUTHERN FRANKLIN...SOUTHWESTERN WEBSTER AND SOUTHEASTERN HARLAN COUNTIES... At 1029 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Bloomington to 10 miles north of Kensington to near Agra, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Smith Center, Franklin, Kensington, Agra, Republican City, Gaylord, Naponee, Bloomington, Riverton, Athol, Harlan, Cedar, Inavale, Harlan County Dam, and Bellaire. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for north central Kansas...and south central Nebraska. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
